identificationModule.briefTitle: Survival and Dialysis Independency in Highly Sensitized Patients After Desensitization With Imlifidase and Tx of Kidneys
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Prospective, Long-term Confirmatory Follow up Trial in Highly Sensitized Patients Treated With Imlifidase or Standard of Care in the ConfIdeS (20-HMedIdeS-17) Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The goal of this follow-up study is to learn about long-term patient survival and graft function in highly sensitized patients who have received desensitization treatment with imlifidase or standard of care (SoC) in order to enable kidney transplantation in clinical study ConfIdeS (20-HMedIdeS-17, NCT04935177).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is an observational follow-up study subsequent to the ConfIdeS study (20-HMedIdeS-17, NCT04935177) in highly sensitized patients who were randomized to imlifidase or SoC desensitization prior to kidney transplantation with a deceased donor graft, or, if SoC perioperative treatment has been deemed not appropriate, wait for a more immunologically compatible organ offer.

After the patients have given written informed consent to participate in the follow-up they will be included in the study and followed until 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study.

Most of the assessments in this study are already part of the follow up within SoC for these patients. During the local clinic routine follow-up visits at year 2, 3 and 5 after randomization in the ConfIdeS study, information about patient survival, wait-list status, graft survival, kidney function, and health related quality of life will be evaluated.

conditions: Kidney Transplantation in Highly Sensitized Patients

armGroups.label: Imlifidase administered in the ConfIdeS study
interventionNames: Drug: Imlifidase administered in the ConfIdeS study

armGroups.label: Best available treatment administered in the ConfIdeS study
interventionNames: Other: Best available treatment administered in the ConfIdeS study

interventions.name: Imlifidase administered in the ConfIdeS study
interventions.description: Imlifidase is an immunoglobulin G (IgG)-degrading enzyme of Streptococcus pyogenes that is highly selective towards IgG. The cleavage of IgG generates one F(ab')2- and one homodimeric Fc- fragment and efficiently neutralizes Fc-mediated activities of IgG.
armGroupLabels: Imlifidase administered in the ConfIdeS study

interventions.name: Best available treatment administered in the ConfIdeS study
interventions.description: Institution-specific desensitization treatment prior to kidney transplantation in the ConfIdeS study OR remain on wait list for a more compatible organ offer if desensitization with institutional protocol is not appropriate
armGroupLabels: Best available treatment administered in the ConfIdeS study

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients alive and free of dialysis at 3 years
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients alive and free of dialysis at 5 years
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients alive at 3 and 5 years
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 and 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Graft failure-free survival rates at 3 and 5 years
secondaryOutcomes.description: Graft failure-free survival is defined as time from randomization to the fist of either graft failure or death
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 and 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Graft survival rates at 3 and 5 years
secondaryOutcomes.description: To be assessed in patients who were transplanted at randomization in the ConfIdeS study
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 and 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients per wait-list category
secondaryOutcomes.description: The different wait-list categories are: transplanted, active, temporary inactive, inactive, or deceased
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 and 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) at 3 and 5 years
secondaryOutcomes.description: eGFR is a measure of kidney function. eGFR will be calculated based on p-creatinine according to the modification of diet in renal disease (MDRD) equation. Kidney disease is characterised by a decreased eGFR value. eGFR will be set to zero, for randomized patients who do not undergo transplantation, lose their graft or die.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 and 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with biopsy- and serology confirmed antibody-mediated rejection (AMR)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 and 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with biopsy confirmed cell-mediated rejection
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 and 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

secondaryOutcomes.description: Any treatments given during rejection episodes will be recorded
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 3 and 5 years after randomization in the ConfIdeS study

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Signed Informed Consent obtained before any trial-related procedures.
2. Previous participation in the clinical trial ConfIdeS.

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Inability by the judgement of the investigator to participate in the trial for any reason.
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients who have participated in the clinical study ConfIdeS (20-HMedIdeS-17, NCT04935177)

locations.facility: University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) Hospital
New York University (NYU) Langone Transplant Institute, NYU Langone Health
